title: Peru - Conflict Data
org: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED)

bites.title: Map of locations
bite: On 5 February 2021, in Lima-Lince, Lima Province, a group of residents of Mariscal Castilla park staged a demonstration against the works of the Municipality that are removing trees in the neighbourhoods, when the works were supposed to only be improving the irrigation canals. [size=no report]

On 5 February 2021, in Coronel Gregorio Albarracin Lanchipa, Tacna, a group of delivery drivers staged a demonstration in Eduardo Perez Gamboa square, to complain about the new coronavirus lockdown measures, that would only let them work at nights and not all day. [size=no report]

On 4 February 2021, in Chimbote, Ancash, a group of informal merchants clashed with municipal police officers with knives, while they were working during the new coronavirus lockdown measures because of the increases of coronavirus cases. No injured reported. [size=no report]

On 4 February 2021, in Piura city, a group of citizens of Los Angeles sector staged a demonstration outside the EPS Grau company offices, to complain about the problems of shortage of potable water, and demanding a solution to the issue. [size=no report]

On 4 February 2021, in Iquitos, Loreto, a group of citizens blocked La Marina avenue, as a demonstration to demand the health director of the sector to give back the ambulance of Bellavista Nanay health center and to provide medical supplies for doctors working with coronavirus infected patients. [size=no report]

On 3 February 2021, in Coronel Gregorio Albarracin Lanchipa, Tacna, a group of health workers of the Health Regional Management staged a demonstration outside the offices, to complain about the regional coordinator, who is the former regional director of the entity. [size=no report]

On 3 February 2021, in Arequipa city, members of the Death to the OPN (Muerte a la OPN) movement staged a demonstration against the Constitutional Tribunal (TP), demanding it to follow the law approved in December that would give the fund to all active and inactive contributors of the Social Security Normalization Office (OPN). [size=no report]

On 2 February 2021, in Chepen, La Libertad, a group of Venezuelan citizens threw rocks at police officers during a police operation, to avoid being arrested. The Venezuelan citizens were throwing a party at the house, when the police arrived to stop the party. [size=no report]

On 2 February 2021, in Lima-Lima District, Lima Province, a group of informal merchants attacked two municipal workers who were trying to remove them from the area of Triangulo de Grau. The merchants threw Molotov bombs to the municipal workers, who were injured. [size=no report]

On 2 February 2021, in Sullana, Piura, a group of doctors, nurses and health technicians hired under CAS contracts staged a demonstration outside the temporary coronavirus hospital in Campeones del 36 stadium, to complain about wage cuts and demanding more budget to be assigned so they can continue working. [size=no report]

On 2 February 2021, in La Union, Piura, a group of locals blocked the entrance of the district for the second consecutive day, to demand the restart of the works of potable water and sewage systems in their sector. The works were supposed to be finished by the end of January 2021. [size=no report]

On 1 February 2021, in La Union, Piura, a group of locals blocked the entrance of the district with burning tires, to demand the restart of the works of potable water and sewage systems. They claimed the works were supposed to be finished by the end of January 2021. [size=no report]

On 1 February 2021, in Paucarpata, Arequipa, a group of workers of the local government offices staged a demonstration in the city to demand the authorities to fumigate offices and to give them medical supplies to avoid coronavirus infection. [size=no report]

On 1 February 2021, in Cabildo, Ica, farmers staged a demonstration against the closure of the road that leads to Gramadal sector, because it complicates the transportation of their products. [size=no report]

On 31 January 2021, around Uchubamba village, Junin, armed people of Uchubamba village and Curimarca village clashed with guns in the sectors of Tambomayo, Mishiquipuquio and La Rinconada, over an ongoing border dispute between both cities. The clash left 3 dead, 28 injured and 6 people missing. One of the killed people was the state attorney of Curimarca community. 3 fatalities.

On 31 January 2021, in Lima-Lima District, Lima Province, a group of citizens staged a demonstration in San Martin square, for the fifth consecutive day, to reject the new coronavirus lockdown measures declared by the government. [size=no report]

On 30 January 2021, in Puno city, a hundred odontology and nursing students of Altiplano National University (UNA) staged a demonstration in front of the Manuel Nunez Butron regional hospital to demand the fulfilment of communitarian internships. [size=a hundred]

On 30 January 2021, in Lima-Lima District, Lima Province, a group of citizens staged a demonstration in San Martin square, for the fourth consecutive day, and later marched towards the Congress offices, to reject the new coronavirus lockdown measures declared by the government. [size=no report]

On 29 January 2021, in Vilcas Huaman, Ayacucho, a group of citizens staged a demonstration outside the General Cordova school infrastructure project, to complain about the councilman in charge of the project. They claimed the councilman did not give employment opportunities in the project for local workers. [size=no report]

On 29 January 2021, in Chimbote, Ancash, a group of informal merchants of El Progreso market clashed with police forces who were carrying out an eviction operative in the market surroundings to control informal sales. They attacked police officers, threw food and other objects at them. [size=no report]

On 29 January 2021, in Arequipa city, a group of local workers marched from Espana square towards the Armas square, as a demonstration to reject the raises in the cost of gas for domestic use. [size=no report]
On 29 January 2021, in Cusco city, a group of local workers marched through the city, as a demonstration to reject the raises in the cost of gas for domestic use. [size=no report]

On 29 January 2021, in Lima-Lima District, Lima Province, a group of citizens staged a demonstration in San Martin square, for the third consecutive day, to reject the new coronavirus lockdown measures declared by the government. [size=no report]

On 28 January 2021, in Coronel Gregorio Albarracin Lanchipa, Tacna, social leaders and citizens staged a demonstration to complain about the insecurity in the sector, demanding more police presence in the city. [size=no report]

On 28 January 2021, in Tacna city, around 500 taxi drivers staged a demonstration in Jose Abelardo Quinonez square, and then carried out a motorcade towards the Civic Center, as a demonstration against the increases of gasoline prices. [size=around 500]

On 28 January 2021, in Lima-Villa El Salvador, Lima Province, a group of citizens staged a demonstration in Separadora Industrial avenue to demand the opening of a pedestrian bridge that leads to Metro de Lima Line 1. [size=no report]

On 28 January 2021, in Lima-Lima District, Lima Province, a group of citizens staged a demonstration in San Martin square for the second consecutive day, to reject the new coronavirus lockdown measures declared by the government. [size=no report]

On 27 January 2021, in Arequipa city, a group of citizens marched through the city as a demonstration to demand the resignation of the province mayor, after he was linked to an investigation of surveillance cameras bought irregularly. [size=no report]

On 27 January 2021, in Lima-Lima District, Lima Province, dozens of citizens staged a demonstration in San Martin square, after president Francisco Sagasti announcement of going back to lockdown to stop the spread of the coronavirus. [size=dozens]
FENUTSSA: North Pacific Union of Health Workers; Health Workers (Peru)

On 27 January 2021, in Iquitos, Loreto, administrative workers of the Loreto Regional Hospital and members of the North Pacific Union of Health Workers (FENUTSSA) staged a demonstration inside the hospital, to complain about discounts to their work benefits, due to a poorly made working report of the region. [size=no report]

On 27 January 2021, in San Lorenzo, Loreto, a group of union health workers of Datem del Maranon province staged a demonstration demanding the destitution of the Health Network director, due to arbitrary layoffs of health workers who had an active CAS contract. [size=no report]
On 27 January 2021, in Cusco city, dozens of delivery drivers of domestic cas carried out a motorcade in the city, to complain about the price increases of gas for domestic use. [size=dozens]

On 27 January 2021, in Puno city, a group of teachers of different provinces staged a demonstration in front of the regional government offices, to demand the renewal of their CAS contracts and to teachers under the CETPROS modality, that worked during the coronavirus lockdown measures. [size=no report]

On 26 January 2021, in Chimbote, Ancash, a group of taxi drivers and delivery men of cans of gas for domestic use blocked Jose Pardo avenue, near Tres de Octubre sector, as a demonstration to reject the raise of prices of gas for domestic use in the city. [size=no report]

On 26 January 2021, in Aguas Verdes, Tumbes, human trafficking smugglers, known as coyotes, clashed with military and police forces, throwing stones at them. The state forces responded shooting fires into the air. No injured reported. The event happened after state forces burned down 10 wooden bridges in the border with Ecuador to prevent the illegal crossing of migrants. [size=no report]

On 26 January 2021, near Suyo municipality, Piura, police forces arrested 74 Venezuelan migrants in El Recodo sector, while they were trying to enter Peru from Ecuador through an illegal pass in Calvas river. Police forces have been patrolling the border to prevent illegal crossings from migrants.

On 26 January 2021, in Tumbes city, there was the deployment of 54 tanks and 1,200 soldiers to the border with Ecuador, to prevent undocumented immigrants from entering Peru during the coronavirus pandemic. Most of the immigrants are from Venezuelan nationality.

On 26 January 2021, in Juliaca, Puno, a group of students of the Nestor Caceres Velasquez Andean University (UANCV) staged a demonstration against the restructure of the administrative workers positions, due to the university not achieving the institutional licensing. [size=no report]

On 26 January 2021, in Puno city, a group of citizens staged a demonstration outside Isla Esteves, during the presentation of the Manuel Nunez Butron hospital technical report where the regional governor was present. They complained about his government management and the poor attention given to the health sector. [size=no report]

On 23 January 2021, in Livitaca, Cusco, a group of citizens blocked the entrance of Constancia mine, of Hudbay mining company, as a demonstration to demand the company a budget assignation for the province, as compensation for their mining operations, which cause environmental damage and contamination. The citizens have been demonstrating for a week. [size=no report]

On 23 January 2021, in Calana, Tacna, a group of cyclists staged a demonstration demanding from authorities to speed up the investigation of the responsible for the death of a cyclist, who was ran over by a car days before. [size=no report]

On 23 January 2021, in Lima-Villa el Salvador, Lima Province, a group of survivors and family members of the accident in which a domestic gas truck crashed and killed 34 people a year before staged a demonstration in the same location of the event in Villa del Mar sector, demanding government justice for the victims of the accident. [size=no report]

On 23 January 2021, in Lima-Santa Anita, Lima Province, more than 130 union workers from the Yellow Line expressway staged a demonstration to demand from the operating company, LAMSAC, better working conditions. They said they work for 12 hours a day, but they have been excluded from the coronavirus compensation bonuses. They also said there had been several cuts in their wages and benefits. [size=more than 130]

On 22 January 2021, in Huancayo, Junin state, dozens of businessmen of the gas sector and residents protested against the lack of action by the Central Government authorities regarding the steep increase in the prices of gas for domestic use. [size=dozens]

On 22 January 2021, in Juliaca, Puno state, a group of residents marched through the streets in a protest against the increase in the gas price in the San Roman province. They also complained against the lack of action from the Central Government authorities. [size=no report]
On 22 January 2021, near Negritos, Piura state, a group of public transportation drivers blocked the Negritos-Talara highway demanding infrastructure improvements. [size=no report]
On 21 January 2021, in Urarinas, Loreto state, a small group of residents protested in front of Petroperu oil company against its privatization. [size=a small group]
On 21 January 2021, near Iquitos, Loreto state, a group of residents blocked a street with tree branches and other objects in a protest for pavement. [size=no report]

On 21 January 2021, in Arequipa, Arequipa state, hundreds of public employees marched towards Plaza de Armas in a protest against the Urgency Decree n. 014. According to the protesters, this decree could have an impact on labor rights. [size=hundreds]

On 21 January 2021, in Putina, Puno state, a group of residents marched through the streets in a protest against the increase in the gas price. They also demanded the construction of a hospital and the improvement of roads from Sillacunca to La Rinconada. [size=no report]
On 21 January 2021, in Juliaca, Puno state, 50 workers protested in front of a private company demanding respect for their labor rights and criticizing arbitrary dismissals. [size=50]
SUTEP: Union of Education Workers of Peru; Teachers (Peru)

On 20 January 2021, in Juliaca, Puno state, over 20 people, including a SUTEP member, marched through the streets in protest against the increase in the gas and transportation prices, in Armas Square and Bolognesi Square. They also complained against the lack of action by the Central Government authorities. [size=over 20]

On 19 January 2021, in Huancavelica, Huancavelica state, a group of teachers of SUTE staged a demonstration demanding the revocation of a Supreme Decree which affects their work positions. [size=no report]

On 19 January 2021, around Limbani village, Puno state, a clash took place between residents of the districts of Limbani and Phara, over the boundary of the two districts, near the Ccapac Orcco area, a mining zone. Over 300 residents of Limbani district were attacked and clashed with at least 500 people of the Phara district. They used sticks, machetes and other objects. At least 26 people were injured. [size=at least 800]
On 19 January 2021, in Sachaca, Arequipa state, a group of residents protested asking for the conservation of the potable water system in the Sachaca district. [size=no report]

On 19 January 2021, in Arequipa, Arequipa state, a group of parents protested against the increase in the monthly fees of San Jeronimo private school. According to the protesters, there was an agreement to reduce fees during the coronavirus pandemic. [size=no report]

On 19 January 2021, in San Juan Bautista, Loreto state, a group of people residents of Bello Horizonte and Eliane Karp settlement protested against the company that was carrying out the sewage work in the area. They claimed the recent works carried out in the area will increase the risks of flooding. [size=no report]
On 19 January 2021, in Puno, Puno state, a group of people protested rejecting the poisoning of fifteen dogs on the riverside of Lake Titicaca on the Costanera road. [size=no report]

On 18 January 2021, in Ayacucho, Ayacucho state, dozens of students marched through the city to demand the return of presential classes. The classes have been online due to the coronavirus pandemic. [size=dozens]

On 18 January 2021, in Sechura, Piura state, a group of fishermen organized a strike and blocked the Sechura bridge to demand the release of four colleagues who had been accused of robbery and sent to detention. The police threw tear gas at the demonstrators and a man was injured. [size=no report]

On 17 January 2021, in Sandia, Puno state, dozens of people marched through the city asking for justice over the death of a couple who were found on a highway near their house. They asked authorities for clarifications over their death. [size=dozens]

On 17 January 2021, in Ayacucho, Ayacucho state, a group of relatives and friends of a man who had been killed marched through the city asking for justice over his death. The protesters claimed that the perpetrators were Venezuelan citizens and should be deported from Peru. [size=no report]
On 15 January 2021, in Abancay, Apurimac, members of the union of distributers of gas for domestic use staged a demonstration to reject the increase of costs of the gas cylinder. [size=no report]

On 15 January 2021, in Arequipa city, citizens and members of the Workers Department union staged a demonstration by marching through the city, to reject the increase of costs of the gas for domestic use [size=no report]

On 15 January 2021, in Lima-Lima District, Lima Province, a group of obstetricians of the Health Ministry (MINSA) staged a demonstration outside the Economic and Finance Ministry (MEF), to demand better working conditions. [size=no report]

On 15 January 2021, in Huancayo city, hundreds of citizens marched through the city, as a demonstration to demand the arrest of two owners of bank cooperatives, who they claimed had stolen from their savings accounts. They burned effigies in protest. [size=hundreds]

On 14 January 2021, in Iquitos, Loreto, a group of citizens blocked the Zungarococha highway with burning tires, as a demonstration to demand La Chacra company manager for solutions for the pollution caused by their operations in the river stream of Corrientillo. [size=no report]

On 14 January 2021, in Arequipa city, a group of students of the Alas Peruanas University staged a demonstration outside the university campus, to complain about authorities not providing an adequate service in giving them their degrees and grades since 2019. [size=no report]

On 14 January 2021, in Piura city, a group of informal merchants clashed with government officials, who were carrying out an eviction operative to remove the merchants from that sector. The merchants used sticks and other objects in the fights. No injured were reported. [size=no report]

On 14 January 2021, in Tacna city, a group of family members and friends of a woman who is missing staged a demonstration in Zela square, and then marched towards the Justice Superior Court offices, demanding a fair and impartial judgment for the main suspect of the disappearance of the woman, since the suspect is a police officer. [size=no report]

On 14 January 2021, in Juliaca, Puno, family members and friends of a mother that lost custody of her son to her father staged a demonstration in Mayor square in the city, complaining about the father of the son not giving enough care to the child. They demanded the transfer of the custody to the mother. [size=no report]
SUTEP: Union of Education Workers of Peru; Teachers (Peru); CGTP: Workers' General Confederation of Peru; Labour Group (Peru)

On 14 January 2021, in Arequipa city, a group of citizens, teachers members of Union of Education Workers of Peru (SUTEP) and workers members of the Workers' General Confederation of Peru (CGTP) staged several demonstrations in several parts of the city, demanding the return of their funds made to the ONP, economic reactivation measures after the coronavirus lockdown measures, and complaining about the increase of gas prices. [size=no report]

On 13 January 2021, in Iquitos, Loreto, a group of farmers staged a demonstration outside the Alto Amazonas Sub Region offices to reject the alleged politization of an agrarian development project, claiming that authorities have not paid attention to their needs. They tried to enter the offices to demand the destitution of the institution manager, but police officers stopped them and dispersed the demonstrators. [size=no report]

On 13 January 2021, in Belen, Loreto, a group of citizens captured a suspected thief near Sol Naciente sector, tied him to a post and beat him up. Police forces later took the man to the police station. [size=no report]

On 13 January 2021, in Tacna city, a group of nurses of UNANUE hospital staged a demonstration outside the hospital, demanding formal contracts and payment of the coronavirus bonus offered to people that worked during the coronavirus lockdown measures. [size=no report]

On 13 January 2021, in Huancayo, Junin, more than 100 teachers members of the National Teachers Union (FENATEPERU) staged a demonstration in front of Mariscal Castilla stadium and the Teacher Social House, to reject the Supreme Decree 015-2020 changes, which allows teachers with a scholarship from Pronabec to be hired directly. The decree also stipulates bilingual education in schools. [size=more than 100]

On 13 January 2021, in Tacna city, a group of administrative workers of the Jorge Basadre National University marched through the center of the city, as a demonstration to reject the economic policies implemented by the president Francisco Sagasti. They also demanded the elimination of the CAS collective contract system. [size=no report]

On 12 January 2021, in San Pedro, Cusco, a group of citizens blocked the Cusco-Arequipa Pan American highway, as a demonstration to demand the reduction in fare costs of urban buses and more budget assigned to the provincial government. [size=no report]

On 12 January 2021, in Combapata, Cusco, a group of citizens blocked the Cusco-Arequipa Pan American highway, as a demonstration to demand the reduction in fare costs of urban buses and more budget assigned to the provincial government. [size=no report]

On 12 January 2021, in Tinta, Cusco, a group of citizens blocked the Cusco-Arequipa Pan American highway, as a demonstration to demand the reduction in fare costs of urban buses and more budget assigned to the provincial government. [size=no report]

On 12 January 2021, in Checacupe, Cusco, a group of citizens blocked the Cusco-Arequipa Pan American highway, as a demonstration to demand the reduction in fare costs of urban buses and more budget assigned to the provincial government. [size=no report]

On 12 January 2021, in Iquitos, Loreto, a group of construction workers staged a demonstration in front of the Maynas government offices, demanding payment of salaries delayed from December, and complaining about the risk of coronavirus contagion they constantly face. [size=no report]

On 12 January 2021, in Cocachacra, Arequipa, a group of citizens of Tambo valley, including local farmers, staged a demonstration in San Francisco square, and then marched towards Mollendo city, to reject the recognition given by the mayor to the Southern Peru mining company, because they claim that the pollution of the mining operations will hurt their crops. [size=no report]

On 12 January 2021, in San Pablo, Cusco, a group of citizens blocked the Cusco-Arequipa Pan American highway, as a demonstration to demand the reduction in fare costs of urban buses and more budget assigned to the provincial government. [size=no report]

On 12 January 2021, in Puno city, a group of teachers staged a demonstration outside the Puno Regional Education Management offices, to reject the Supreme Decree 015-2020 changes, which lets teachers with a scholarship from Pronabec to be directly hired. They demanded authorities to consider a meritocracy exam. [size=no report]
On 12 January 2021, in Puno city, a group of heavy load workers staged a demonstration in the 7th kilometer of Puno-Laraqueri highway, to reject the price increases of concrete. [size=no report]

On 11 January 2021, in Iquitos, Loreto, hundreds of cacao farmers from Tamshiyacu city staged a demonstration against the decisions made by the Environmental Evaluation Organism (OEFA) against TAMSHI company, the company that grows and sells cacao. They claimed that the decisions are arbitrary and abusive, and harm their economic situation, especially during the coronavirus lockdown measures. [size=hundreds]

On 11 January 2021, in Iquitos, Loreto, a group of substitute teachers staged a demonstration outside the Education Management offices in the city, to complain about receiving less than half of the coronavirus compensation bonus offered by the government to people that worked during the coronavirus lockdown measures. [size=no report]

On 11 January 2021, in Tumbes city, a group of citizens of Cerro Blanco sector blocked the highway that enters the city, to demand improvement of the potable water service and sewage system. Police forces intervened in the demonstration, and a fight between both groups occurred. Police forces used tear gas to disperse them. 6 citizens were injured. [size=no report]

On 11 January 2021, in Juliaca, Puno, health workers of the Carlos Monge Medrano hospital staged a demonstration outside the Health Network Administration offices in the city, to demand payment of the salary of December, benefits and the coronavirus bonus offered by the government for people that worked during the coronavirus lockdown, as well as contract renewal for all workers employed. [size=no report]

On 10 January 2021, in Olmos, Lambayeque, a group of citizens marched through the city, around the main park, as a demonstration to demand the mayor to fulfil his promise of installing a medicinal oxygen plant in the city to treat coronavirus infected patients. [size=no report]

On 10 January 2021, in Sullana, Piura, a group of students from Los Angeles Catholic University (ULADECH) marched through the city towards the university campus, as a demonstration demanding the dean of the university to hand administration to the Trujillo Catholic University, since both universities were merged. [size=no report]

On 9 January 2021, in Lima-Lima District, Lima Province, dozens of citizens staged a demonstration in San Martin square, demanding authorities a faster investigation in the case of citizens killed by police repression during the demonstrations of 14 November last year, against the government of Manuel Merino. [size=dozens]

On 8 January 2021, in Caballococha, Loreto, hundreds of citizens staged a demonstration outside the Electro Oriente electricity services provider company, to complain about the continuous blackouts in the city and the poor service provision of the company. [size=hundreds]

On 8 January 2021, in Iquitos, Loreto, a group of citizens blocked the Iquitos-Nauta highway with burning tires, as a demonstration to demand the regional government to start the construction of the Santo Tomas highway. [size=no report]

On 8 January 2021, in Punchana, Loreto, a group of citizens of Juan Cardama sector staged a to demand from the district commune their support for the construction of a bridge, before the river level rises during winter season. [size=no report]

On 8 January 2021, in Chiclayo, Lambayeque, a group of workers from AgroPucala staged a demonstration outside the civil courts of the city, in 7 de Enero avenue, to demand payment of the owed salaries for more than a year, as well as demanding the resignation of the current management from the company. [size=no report]

On 8 January 2021, in Tacna city, hundreds of citizens marched from Zela square towards Paseo Civico, as a demonstration to complain about the death of a dog that was beaten up by his owner. They demanded the authorities to judge this case accordingly. [size=hundreds]

On 8 January 2021, in Sullana, Piura, a group of informal merchants of a small market clashed against police forces, while they were carrying out an eviction operative in the streets around the sector. No injured were reported. [size=no report]

On 8 January 2021, in Chimbote, Ancash, a group of informal merchants of the former market El Progreso clashed against Police Forces, while they were carrying out an eviction operative in the streets around the former market. The merchants threw rocks and other objects at the officers. 5 police officers were injured. [size=no report]

On 7 January 2021, in Chiclayo, Lambayeque, a group of workers from AgroPucala blocked the Chiclayo-Chota highway with tires and stones, as a demonstration to demand payment of the owed salaries for more than a year, as well as demanding the resignation of the current management of the company. [size=no report]

On 7 January 2021, in Velille, Cusco, a group of citizens blocked the South Mining Corridor highway, as a demonstration to complain about Las Bambas mining company not accepting the proposal of a monetary contribution to help them deal with the impact of the coronavirus lockdown. They also demanded financial support to the communities affected by mining operations. This is the 22nd day the highway has been blocked. [size=no report]

On 7 January 2021, in Arequipa city, a group of merchants of the Metropolitano market staged a demonstration against the closure of Vidaurrazaga avenue, that leads towards the market and the Andres Avelino Caceres commercial platform. [size=no report]

On 6 January 2021, in Iquitos, Loreto, a group of civil construction workers staged a demonstration by burning tires outside the Rosa Agustina Donayre de Monrey school, to complain about the delayed payments of their salaries from the Johesa Constructores company. [size=no report]

On 6 January 2021, in Juliaca, Puno, a group of citizens captured and beat up a thief near Pedro Vilcapaza market. The thief was later taken by police officers to the Sectorial police station. [size=no report]

On 6 January 2021, in Velille, Cusco, a group of citizens blocked the South Mining Corridor highway, as a demonstration to complain about Las Bambas mining company not accepting the proposal of a monetary contribution to help them deal with the impact of the coronavirus lockdown. They also demanded financial support to the communities affected by mining operations. This is the 21st day the highway has been blocked. [size=no report]

On 6 January 2021, in Tacna city, citizens and family members of a woman that has been missing staged a demonstration outside the Justice Superior Court offices and in front of the Public ministry offices, to demand the apprehension of the police officer that is one of the main suspects of the disappearance, after the court denied the preventive prison for the officer. Police forces intervened and pushed the demonstrators outside the Public ministry offices, and that turned into a clash. The mother of the missing woman was injured. [size=no report]

On 5 January 2021, in Trujillo, La Libertad, around 50 citizens, construction workers and representative of a construction companies consortium staged a demonstration outside a Bank office in the city center, to complain about the freezing of their accounts, which prevented payments into their accounts. [size=around 50]

On 5 January 2021, in Velille, Cusco, a group of citizens blocked the South Mining Corridor highway, as a demonstration to complain about Las Bambas mining company not accepting the proposal of a monetary contribution to help them deal with the impact of the coronavirus lockdown. They also demanded financial support to the communities affected by mining operations. This is the 20th day the highway has been blocked. [size=no report]

On 5 January 2021, in Huamancaca Chico, Junin, more than 100 citizens blocked the entrance of the Huancayo prison with burning tires and stones, as a demonstration to complain about the cellphone and internet signal blocker placed in the prison, which affects locals as well. [size=more than 100]

On 5 January 2021, in Lima-Independencia, Lima Province, a group of informal merchants clashed with government officials and residents of the Tahuantinsuyo market, in Quiquijana sector, after an eviction operative was being carried out by the officials. After the clash, the merchants claimed that the mayor has ignored their request of a dialogue. [size=no report]

On 5 January 2021, in Callao city, a group of public sanitation workers staged a protest and blocked the road to prevent the trash recollection hired by the provincial government, as a demonstration against the decision of the municipal government of not renewing their contract with the cleaning company Eslimp Callao. They demanded their reinstatement with higher salaries and benefits. [size=no report]

On 5 January 2021, in Ayacucho city, health workers of the Ayacucho Regional hospital staged a demonstration against the newly appointed manager of the hospital. They claimed she has a negative record on previous positions. They also claimed the appointment would endanger the control of coronavirus in the hospital. [size=no report]

On 5 January 2021, in Chiclayo, Lambayeque, residents of Cerropon sector staged a demonstration outside the Sanitary Services Entity (EPSEL) offices, to complain about the lack of potable water services in their sector and in La Molina and La Colina de Las Brisas sectors. [size=no report]

On 4 January 2021, in Iquitos, Loreto, a group of citizens of Requena and Nauta staged a demonstration outside the Loreto regional government, to demand the governor to restart the electricity project of rural communities. The project has been paused before the coronavirus lockdown measures, but workers claimed that the restart of it would help out citizens to have jobs. [size=no report]

On 4 January 2021, in Iquitos, Loreto, nurses staged a demonstration in the city to complain about not being included in the coronavirus pandemic bonus offered to all health sector that worked during the lockdown. [size=no report]

On 4 January 2021, in Trujillo, La Libertad, family members, friends and neighbors of a girl that was sexually assaulted and killed by a man staged a demonstration in the cemetery of the city demanding justice on the case and a life sentence to the responsible. [size=no report]

On 4 January 2021, in Velille, Cusco, a group of citizens blocked the South Mining Corridor highway, as a demonstration to complain about Las Bambas mining company not accepting the proposal of a monetary contribution to help them deal with the impact of the coronavirus lockdown. They also demanded financial support to the communities affected by mining operations. This is the 19th day the highway has been blocked. [size=no report]

On 3 January 2021, in Velille, Cusco, a group of citizens blocked the South Mining Corridor highway, as a demonstration to complain about Las Bambas mining company not accepting the proposal of a monetary contribution to help them deal with the impact of the coronavirus lockdown. They also demanded financial support to the communities affected by mining operations. This is the 18th day the highway has been blocked. [size=no report]

On 3 January 2021, in Lima-San Juan de Lurigancho, Lima Province, a group of citizens captured a thief that had stolen cellphones with 2 other accomplices in a bus in Ramiro Priale highway, and that later hid in under a bed in a house. No reports on injured. The police had to intervene in the street fighting, creating a barricade between the two rioters.

Around 29 October 2018 (as reported), in Chiclayo, Lambayeque, more than 400 workers at the provincial municipality of Chiclayo took to the streets to protest against the delay in the payment of their salaries. [size=more than 400]

On 5 January 2018, an auction for a 25 year concession of a public space in Barranco, Lima was postponed due to protests of citizens of the neighboring zone that was trying to be auctioned with the support of a congressman. Protesters were against a public space being given to a company with no experience on handling public spaces, with underprice, and with no other company competing on the concession.

On 4 January 2018, members of Popular Force thanked the current president at the time, Pedro Kuczynski, for the pardon given to Alberto Fujimori. FP members marched outside Kuczynski's house in San Isidro, Lima.

On 2 February 2018, although a settlement was reached between the government and potato farmers, In La Oroya there were still road blocks. The reason is that the farmers from that sector do not recognize that agreement, because they want the government to declare emergency in the agriculture sector and that the import of certain kinds of potatoes to stop. This marks as the 1st day of roadblocks in La Oroya.

On 2 January 2018, an unidentified armed group started shooting into the air and into houses to force civilians to leave their houses in Perene, Chanchamayo. The armed group are assumed to be illegal land occupiers. The event left 3 civilians injured. 15 people were later arrested.
